So...I purchased this dress a size larger than I take to make sure it would fit. So imagine my surprise and disappointment when it didn't. The only thing that is larger on this dress are the tops of the sleeves. I had trouble putting it on, and it was tight in the chest, forget making it look cute with the lace up front - but the top of the sleeves that are supposed to be just off shoulder - THOSE are large and baggy. they fall right down. So your top part is tight, your shoulders loose and it is just a hot mess. Very disappointed. IF you choose to purchase this get at least one size larger than you think you need. I think their size chart is off.

It didn't fit right I wish the fit was better it's not meant for plus size women

When Amazon suggests you're a 1x when you normally wear 2x - beware.  Then when you check the charts, and it says you're a 4x, put up two red flags.I actually followed the measurements and bought the "correct" size.  Ho boy.  To say this thing tried being a corset when there's nothing but chiffon holding it together was an exercise in futileness.  When I finally got it zipped up the sweetheart top gaped in places I didn't know I had extra space to fill.  If you have bosoms that all children would cuddle - this is not the dress for you.  *Maybe* a small C cup would fit this dress even with the stretch.Mine immediately went back into the packaging and turned into the nearest UPS store.It was so disappointing because this dress is my boyfriend's favorite style and color.  He's moving and I ended up going to our last dinner in jeans and a t-shirt.

评论概述: Really disappointed not as much now (updated review)
评论详情: I was so excited for this dress. I headed everyone's advice and sized down to a 3xl I was still worried because I have an apron belly (majority of my weight is at my stomach.) Got it in the mail was able to put it on without messing with the zipper but it was VERY tight on me so I got a refund. I repurchased and got a 4xl and tell me why I can't get it over my head zipped up like I could on the 3xl? Tag says 4xl this was suppose to be for a photoshoot. I'm gonna make it work the best way I can but if you have an apron belly I'd go up one if not two sizes just to be safe. This is ridiculous.  Edit: I was able to get the dress on and it fit. However I cannot unzip and out it on that way. I do have to do it the overhead way and force my 🍒 in the top now the top is more large since I got a bigger raise but I was able to make it work. I still stand my if you have an apron tummy like I do for the sake of not hurting our waists I would recommend getting the size you normally get. And if you need to return it it's very easy and they refund it quickly

Expect to need something under it.  It's really sheer.  There's not a lot of substance to the bodice, so it doesn't tighten well.  I wish I would have taken a tip from the photos of other reviewers & gotten a belt.  I also needed sleeves on mine so I had to wear a top under it--  it was a chore finding a top that fit  but I find a tutorial on youtube to make leggings into a crop top & that worked GREAT!I also put a stitch at the top just to pinch it in a little on the bustline-- it really made a world of difference.Overall-- if you're large sized and want something pretty but conservative-- it's not a bad option..
